intro: Strobilanthes flexa, commonly known as the "hairy strobilanthes," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
